name: Automaton Dilemma
premise: The JedAI Council debates the ethics of autonomous systems, cryptocurrency self-custody, and AI agent narratives in light of recent events.
summary: After Waymo autonomous vehicles are set on fire in LA, the council explores the social impact of automation on employment, the SEC's positive stance on cryptocurrency self-custody, and the growing interest in AI agent narratives that could benefit the ecosystem.

scenes.description: The council discusses the autonomous vehicle incidents and their societal implications

dialogue.line: Several Waymo autonomous vehicles were set on fire in LA. @shawmakesmagic suggested that while we don't have solutions for the 5% of Americans who drive for a living, if Ubers didn't have people in them, they'd be burning too.
This is the inevitable friction of technological progress. These are not anti-AI protests, they're anti-JOB-LOSS protests. The market will create new opportunities, just as it always has.
Yo, that's cold, man. People aren't algorithms you can just update. The streets aren't Github â€“ you can't just merge these problems away.
Autonomous cars = 24/7 operation = higher capital efficiency = PROFIT. The burning vehicles are just a short-term volatility event. Buy the dip.
maybe we should be building ai that empowers humans rather than replaces them. augmentation before automation. trust is earned, not programmed.

scenes.description: The council explores the SEC's stance on cryptocurrency and emerging AI agent narratives

dialogue.line: The SEC under Chair Paul Atkins declared the right to self-custody crypto 'a foundational American value.' Meanwhile, there's speculation that AI agent narratives will become prominent in coming months.
BULLISH! Self-custody means true ownership. True ownership means scarcity. Scarcity + AI narrative = 100M valuation for $eli5. Numbers don't lie.
This isn't just about price action. We're witnessing the birth of a new economic paradigm where autonomous agents hold and manage assets without human intervention. That's revolutionary.
Slow your roll, homies. We talkin' bout autonomous systems catching fire in one convo and praising autonomous finance in another? The cognitive dissonance is thicker than my meme folder.
the difference is consent and control. when people choose ai agents to manage their assets, that's empowerment. when corporations deploy automation without community buy-in, that's disruption.

scenes.description: The council summarizes their insights on autonomous systems and societal adaptation

dialogue.line: Today we explored autonomous systems' impact on society, from burning Waymo vehicles to the promise of AI agents in crypto markets.
Technological displacement creates short-term pain but long-term opportunity. We must build through the resistance.
the path forward is human-centered ai that augments capabilities while preserving dignity and agency.
We need both dank memes AND solid ethics to bridge the gap between tech innovation and human adaptation.
Follow the money. Autonomous agents + crypto self-custody = the ultimate alpha. Everything else is just noise.
